32.verse: from Shemida came the Shemidaite ·family group [clan]; from Hepher came the Hepherite ·family group [clan].

33.verse: (Zelophehad son of Hepher had no sons; he had only daughters, and their names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah [27:1–11; 36:1–13; Josh. 17:3–6].)

34.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] of Manasseh, and the total number of men was 52,700.

35.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] in the ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Ephraim: From Shuthelah came the Shuthelahite ·family group [clan]; from Beker came the Bekerite ·family group [clan]; from Tahan came the Tahanite ·family group [clan].

36.verse: This was the ·family group [clan] from Shuthelah: From Eran came the Eranite ·family group [clan].

37.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] of [the sons/descendants of] Ephraim, and the total number of men was 32,500. These are the ·family groups [clans] that came from Joseph.

38.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] in the ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Benjamin: From Bela came the Belaite ·family group [clan]; from Ashbel came the Ashbelite ·family group [clan]; from Ahiram came the Ahiramite ·family group [clan];

39.verse: from Shupham came the Shuphamite ·family group [clan]; from Hupham came the Huphamite ·family group [clan].

40.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] from Bela through Ard and Naaman: From Ard came the Ardite ·family group [clan]; from Naaman came the Naamite ·family group [clan].

41.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] of Benjamin, and the total number of men was 45,600.

42.verse: This was the ·family group [clan] in the ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Dan: From Shuham came the Shuhamite ·family group [clan]. That was the ·family group [clan] of Dan,

43.verse: and the total number of men in the Shuhamite ·family group [clan] of Dan was 64,400.

44.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] in the ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Asher: From Imnah came the Imnite ·family group [clan]; from Ishvi came the Ishvite ·family group [clan]; from Beriah came the Beriite ·family group [clan].

45.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] that came from Beriah: From Heber came the Heberite ·family group [clan]; from Malkiel came the Malkielite ·family group [clan].

46.verse: (Asher also had a daughter named Serah.)

47.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] of Asher, and the total number of men was 53,400.

48.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] in the ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Naphtali: From Jahzeel came the Jahzeelite ·family group [clan]; from Guni came the Gunite ·family group [clan];

49.verse: from Jezer came the Jezerite ·family group [clan]; from Shillem came the Shillemite ·family group [clan].

50.verse: These were the ·family groups [clans] of Naphtali, and the total number of men was 45,400.

51.verse: So the total number of the ·men [sons; children] of Israel was 601,730.

53.verse: “·Divide [Apportion] the land among these people by the number of names.

54.verse: A large tribe will get more ·land [inheritance], and a small tribe will get less ·land [inheritance]; the amount of ·land each tribe gets [inheritance] will depend on the number of its people.

55.verse: ·Divide [Apportion] the land by drawing lots, and the land each tribe ·gets [inherits] will be named for that tribe.

56.verse: ·Divide [Apportion] the land between large and small groups by drawing lots [Josh. 14:2; 18:6, 8].”

57.verse: The tribe of Levi was also counted. These were the ·family groups [clans] of Levi: From Gershon came the Gershonite ·family group [clan]; from Kohath came the Kohathite ·family group [clan]; from Merari came the Merarite ·family group [clan].

58.verse: These also were Levite ·family groups [clans]: the Libnite ·family group [clan], the Hebronite ·family group [clan], the Mahlite ·family group [clan], the Mushite ·family group [clan], and the Korahite ·family group [clan]. (Kohath was the ancestor of Amram,

59.verse: whose wife was named Jochebed. She was from the tribe of Levi and she was born in Egypt. She and Amram had two sons, Aaron and Moses, and their sister Miriam [Ex. 2:1–10].

60.verse: Aaron was the father of Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

61.verse: But Nadab and Abihu died because they made an offering before the LORD with ·the wrong kind of [strange; unauthorized by God] fire [Lev. 10:1–20].)

62.verse: The total number of male Levites one month old or older was 23,000. But these men were not counted with the other ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel], because they were not given any ·of the land [inheritance] among the other ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel].

63.verse: Moses and Eleazar the priest counted all these people. They counted the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] on the plains of Moab across the Jordan River from Jericho.

64.verse: Moses and Aaron the priest had counted the Israelites in the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Sinai [1:1–54], but no one Moses counted on the plains of Moab was in the first counting.

65.verse: The LORD had told the Israelites they would all die in the ·desert [wilderness], and the only two left were Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun [14:20–25].

1.verse: Zelophehad’s Daughters - Then the daughters of Zelophehad came near. Zelophehad was the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh. Zelophehad’s daughters belonged to the ·family groups [clans] of Manasseh son of Joseph [26:29–34]. The daughters’ names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

2.verse: They went to the entrance of the Meeting Tent and stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the leaders, and all the ·people [community; congregation; assembly]. They said,

3.verse: “Our father died in the ·desert [wilderness]. He was not ·one of Korah’s followers [in the community/congregation/assembly of Korah] who came together against the LORD [16:1–50], but he died because of his own sin, and he had no sons.

4.verse: ·Our father’s name will [Why should our father’s name…?] die out because he had no sons. Give us ·property [a possession] among our father’s relatives [36:1–13; Josh. 17:3–6].”

5.verse: So Moses brought their case to the LORD,

6.verse: and the LORD said to him,

7.verse: “The daughters of Zelophehad are right; they should certainly get ·what their father owned [a possession of the inheritance in the midst of the relatives of their father]. ·Give [Pass on to] them ·property among their father’s relatives [the inheritance of their father].

8.verse: “Tell the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel], ‘If a man dies and has no son, then ·everything he owned should go [pass on his inheritance] to his daughter.

9.verse: If he has no daughter, then ·everything he owned should go [you should give his inheritance] to his brothers.

10.verse: If he has no brothers, then ·everything he owned should go [you should give his inheritance] to his father’s brothers.

11.verse: And if his father had no brothers, then ·everything he owned should go [you should give his inheritance] to the nearest relative in his ·family group [clan]. This should be a ·rule [statute; ordinance; requirement] among the ·people [sons; children] of Israel, as the LORD has given this command to Moses.’”

12.verse: Joshua Is the New Leader - Then the LORD said to Moses, “Climb this mountain in the Abarim Mountains, and look at the land I have given to the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel].

13.verse: After you have seen it, you will ·die and join your ancestors [be gathered to your people] as your brother Aaron ·did [was gathered; 20:22–29],

14.verse: because you both ·acted [rebelled] against my command in the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Zin. You did not honor me as holy before the people at the waters of Meribah [20:1–13].” (This was at Meribah in Kadesh in the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Zin.)

15.verse: Moses said to the LORD,

16.verse: “The LORD is the God of the spirits of all ·people [flesh]. May he ·choose a leader for these people [appoint someone over the community/assembly/congregation],

17.verse: who will go in and out before them. He must lead them out like sheep and bring them in; the LORD’s ·people [community; assembly; congregation] must not be like sheep without a shepherd.”

18.verse: So the LORD said to Moses, “Take Joshua son of Nun, because my Spirit is in him. ·Put [Lay] your hand on him,

19.verse: and have him stand before Eleazar the priest and all the ·people [community; assembly; congregation]. Then give him his orders ·as they watch [before their eyes].

20.verse: Let him share your honor so that all the ·Israelites [community/assembly/congregation of the sons/children of Israel] will ·obey [listen to] him.

21.verse: He must stand before Eleazar the priest, and Eleazar will get advice from the LORD by using the Urim [Ex. 28:30]. At his command all the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel, the whole community/assembly/congregation] will go out, and at his command they will all come in.”

22.verse: Moses did what the LORD told him. He took Joshua and had him stand before Eleazar the priest and all the ·people [community; assembly; congregation],

23.verse: and he ·put [lay] his hands on him and gave him orders, just as the LORD had told him.

1.verse: Daily Offerings - The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “Give this command to the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel]. Tell them: ‘Bring me food offerings made by fire, for a smell that is pleasing to me, and be sure to bring them at the ·right [appointed] time.’

3.verse: Say to them, ‘These are the offerings you must bring to the LORD: two male lambs, a year old, as a burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17] each day. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

4.verse: Offer one lamb in the morning and the other lamb ·at twilight [between the two evenings].

5.verse: Also bring a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] of ·two quarts [one-tenth of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour, mixed with ·one quart [one-fourth of a hin] of oil from pressed olives.

6.verse: This is the daily burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17] which began at Mount Sinai; its smell is pleasing to the LORD.

7.verse: Offer ·one quart [one-fourth of a hin] of wine with each lamb as a drink offering; pour it out to the LORD at the Holy Place.

8.verse: Offer the second lamb at ·twilight [between the two evenings]. As in the morning, also give a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] and a drink offering. This offering is made by fire, and its smell is pleasing to the LORD [Ex. 29:38–43].

9.verse: Sabbath Offerings - “‘On the Sabbath day you must give two male lambs, a year old, that have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish]. Also give a drink offering and a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1]; the ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] must be four quarts of fine flour mixed with olive oil.

10.verse: This is the burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17] for every Sabbath, in addition to the daily burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17] and drink offering.

11.verse: Monthly Offerings - “‘On the first day of each month bring a burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17] to the LORD. This will be two young bulls, one ·male sheep [ram], and seven male lambs a year old, and they must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

12.verse: Give a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] with each bull of ·six quarts [three-tenths of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with olive oil. Also give a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] with the ·male sheep [ram]. It must be ·four quarts [two-tenths of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with olive oil.

13.verse: And give a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] with each lamb of ·two quarts [one-tenth of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with olive oil. This is a burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17], and its smell is pleasing to the LORD.

14.verse: The drink offering with each bull will be ·two quarts [half a hin] of wine, with the ·male sheep [ram] it will be ·one and one-third quarts [one-third of a hin], and with each lamb it will be ·one quart [one-fourth of a hin] of wine. This is the burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17] that must be offered each month of the year.

15.verse: Besides the daily burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17] and drink offerings, bring a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3] of one goat to the LORD.

16.verse: The Passover - “‘The LORD’s Passover will be on the fourteenth day of the first month [Ex. 12:1–20; Lev. 23:4–8; Deut. 16:1–8].

17.verse: The Feast of Unleavened Bread begins on the fifteenth day of that month. For seven days, you may eat only bread made without ·yeast [leaven].

18.verse: Have a ·holy meeting [sacred/solemn convocation] on the first day of the festival, and don’t work that day.

19.verse: Bring to the LORD an offering made by fire, a burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17] of two young bulls, one ·male sheep [ram], and seven male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

20.verse: With each bull give a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] of ·six quarts [three-tenths of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with olive oil. With the ·male sheep [ram] it must be ·four quarts [two-tenths of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with oil.

21.verse: With each of the seven lambs, it must be ·two quarts [one-tenth of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with oil.

22.verse: Bring one goat as a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3], to ·remove your sins so you will belong to God [make atonement for yourself].

23.verse: Bring these offerings in addition to the burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17] you give every morning.

24.verse: So bring food for the offering made by fire each day for seven days, for a smell that is pleasing to the LORD. Do it in addition to the daily burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17] and its drink offering.

25.verse: On the seventh day have a holy meeting [sacred/solemn convocation], and don’t work that day.

26.verse: The Feast of Weeks - “‘On the day of firstfruits when you bring new grain to the LORD during the Feast of Weeks [Lev. 23:15–23], have a ·holy meeting [sacred/solemn convocation]. Don’t work that day.

27.verse: Bring this burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17] to the LORD: two young bulls, one ·male sheep [ram], and seven male lambs a year old. This smell is pleasing to the LORD.

28.verse: Also, with each bull give a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] of ·six quarts [three-tenths of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with oil. With the ·male sheep [ram], it must be ·four quarts [two-tenths of an ephah] of flour,

29.verse: and with each of the seven lambs offer ·two quarts [one-tenth of an ephah] of flour.

30.verse: Offer one male goat to ·remove your sins so you will belong to God [make atonement for yourself].

31.verse: Bring these offerings and their drink offerings in addition to the daily burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17] and its ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1]. The animals must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

1.verse: The Feast of Trumpets - “‘Have a ·holy meeting [sacred/solemn convocation] on the first day of the seventh month, and don’t work on that day. That is the day you blow the trumpets.

2.verse: Bring these burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17] as a smell pleasing to the LORD: one young bull, one ·male sheep [ram], and seven male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

3.verse: With the bull give a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] of ·six quarts [three-tenths of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with oil. With the ·male sheep [ram] offer ·four quarts [two-tenths of an ephah],

4.verse: and with each of the seven lambs offer ·two quarts [one-tenth of an ephah].

5.verse: Offer one male goat for a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3] to ·remove your sins so you will belong to God [make atonement for yourself].

6.verse: These offerings are in addition to the monthly [28:11–15] and daily burnt offerings [28:1–8; Lev. 1:1–17]. Their ·grain [gift; tribute] offerings [Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings must be done as you have been told. These offerings are made by fire to the LORD, and their smell is pleasing to him.

7.verse: The Day of Atonement - “‘Have a ·holy meeting [sacred/solemn convocation] on the tenth day of the seventh month [Lev. 16; 23:26–32]. On that day do not eat and do not work.

8.verse: Bring these burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17] as a smell pleasing to the LORD: one young bull, one ·male sheep [ram], and seven male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

9.verse: With the bull give a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] of ·six quarts [three-tenths of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with oil. With the ·male sheep [ram] it must be ·four quarts [two-tenths of an ephah],

10.verse: and with each of the seven lambs it must be ·two quarts [one-tenth of an ephah].

11.verse: Offer one male goat as a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3]. This will be in addition to the sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3] which ·removes your sins [makes atonement for you], the daily burnt offering [28:1–8; Lev. 1:1–17] with its ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1], and the drink offerings.

12.verse: The Feast of Shelters - “‘Have a ·holy meeting [sacred/solemn convocation] on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, and do not work on that day. Celebrate a festival to the LORD for seven days [Lev. 23:33–44].

13.verse: Bring these burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17], made by fire, as a smell pleasing to the LORD: thirteen young bulls, two ·male sheep [rams], and fourteen male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

14.verse: With each of the thirteen bulls offer a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [Lev. 2:1] of ·six quarts [three-tenths of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with oil. With each of the two ·male sheep [rams] it must be ·four quarts [two-tenths of an ephah],

15.verse: and with each of the fourteen lambs it must be ·two quarts [one-tenth of an ephah].

16.verse: Offer one male goat as a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3] in addition to the daily burnt offering [28:1–8; Lev. 1:1–17] with its ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings.

17.verse: “‘On the second day of this festival give an offering of twelve bulls, two ·male sheep [rams], and fourteen male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

18.verse: Bring the ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings for the bulls, sheep, and lambs, according to the number required.

19.verse: Offer one male goat as a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3], in addition to the daily burnt offering [28:1–8; Lev. 1:1–17] with its ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings.

20.verse: “‘On the third day offer eleven bulls, two ·male sheep [rams], and fourteen male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

21.verse: Bring the ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings for the bulls, sheep, and lambs, according to the number required.

22.verse: Offer one male goat as a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3], in addition to the daily burnt offering [28:1–8; Lev. 1:1–17] with its ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings.

23.verse: “‘On the fourth day offer ten bulls, two ·male sheep [rams], and fourteen male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

24.verse: Bring the ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings for the bulls, sheep, and lambs, according to the number required.

25.verse: Offer one male goat as a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3], in addition to the daily burnt offering [28:1–8] with its ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings.

26.verse: “‘On the fifth day offer nine bulls, two ·male sheep [rams], and fourteen male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

27.verse: Bring the ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings for the bulls, sheep, and lambs, according to the number required.

28.verse: Offer one male goat as a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3], in addition to the daily burnt offering [28:1–8; Lev. 1:1–17] with its ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings.

29.verse: “‘On the sixth day offer eight bulls, two ·male sheep [rams], and fourteen male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

30.verse: Bring the ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings for the bulls, sheep, and lambs, according to the number required.

31.verse: Offer one male goat as a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3], in addition to the daily burnt offering [28:1–8; Lev. 1:1–17] with its ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings.

32.verse: “‘On the seventh day offer seven bulls, two ·male sheep [rams], and fourteen male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

33.verse: Bring the ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings for the bulls, sheep, and lambs, according to the number required.

34.verse: Offer one male goat as a ·sin [or purification] offering [Lev. 4:3], in addition to the daily burnt offering [28:1–8; Lev. 1:1–17] with its ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings.

35.verse: “‘On the eighth day have a ·closing meeting [closing/festive assembly], and do not work on that day.

36.verse: Bring an offering made by fire, a burnt offering [Lev. 1:1–17], as a smell pleasing to the LORD. Offer one bull, one ·male sheep [ram], and seven male lambs a year old. They must have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish].

37.verse: Bring the ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings for the bull, the ·male sheep [ram], and the lambs, according to the number required.

38.verse: Offer one male goat as a ·sin [or purification; Lev. 4:3] offering, in addition to the daily burnt offering [28:1–8; Lev. 1:1–17] with its grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 2:1] and drink offerings.

39.verse: “‘At your ·festivals [sacred/solemn convocations] you should bring these to the LORD: your burnt offerings [1:1–17], ·grain [gift; tribute] offerings [Lev. 2:1], drink offerings and ·fellowship [or peace; well-being] offerings [Lev. 3:1]. These are in addition to other ·promised [votive] offerings and special gifts you want to give to the LORD.’”

40.verse: Moses told the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] everything the LORD had commanded him.

1.verse: Rules About Special Promises - Moses spoke with the leaders of the ·Israelite tribes [tribes of the sons/children of Israel]. He told them these commands from the LORD.

2.verse: “If a man makes a ·promise [vow] to the LORD or ·says he will do something special [swears an oath to bind himself to an obligation], he must ·keep his promise [not break his word]. He must do what he said [Deut. 23:21; Ps. 50:14; Eccl. 5:4–5; Matt. 5:33–37].

3.verse: If a young woman still living at ·home [the house of her father] makes a ·promise [vow] to the LORD or ·pledges to do something special [binds herself to an obligation],

4.verse: and if her father hears about the ·promise [vow] or ·pledge [obligation by which she has bound herself] and says nothing, ·she must do what she promised [all her vows stand]. ·She must keep her pledge [All her obligations to which she has bound herself will stand].

5.verse: But if her father hears about the ·promise [vow] or ·pledge [obligation by which she has bound herself] and ·does not allow it [disapproves], then the ·promise [vow] or ·pledge [obligation] does not ·have to be kept [stand]. Her father ·would not allow it [disapproves], so the LORD will ·free her from her promise [forgive her].

6.verse: “If a woman ·makes a pledge [binds herself to an obligation] or speaks a ·careless [rash; thoughtless] ·promise [vow] and then gets married,

7.verse: and if her husband hears about it and says nothing, ·she must keep her promise [her vow stands] ·or the pledge she made [and the obligation by which she bound herself will stand].

8.verse: But if her husband hears about it and ·does not allow it [disapproves], he cancels her ·pledge [vow] or the ·careless [rash; thoughtless] ·promise [vow] ·she made [by which she bound herself]. The LORD will ·free her from keeping it [forgive her].

9.verse: “If a widow or divorced woman makes a ·promise [vow], ·she must do whatever she promised [all by which she bound herself stands].

10.verse: “If a woman makes a ·promise [vow] or ·pledge [binds herself in an obligation] ·while she is married [in the house of her husband],

11.verse: and if her husband hears about it but says nothing and does not ·stop her [disapprove], ·she must keep her promise [all her vows stand] ·or pledge [and all that to which she bound herself will stand].

12.verse: But if her husband hears about it and cancels it, ·she does not have to do what she said [her vow and all that which she bound herself do not stand]. Her husband has canceled it, so the LORD will ·free her from it [forgive her].

13.verse: A woman’s husband may make her keep or cancel any ·promise [vow] or ·pledge [obligation] she has made to ·deny [mortify] herself.

14.verse: If he says nothing to her about it for several days, ·she must keep her promises [her vows stand]. If he hears about them and says nothing, ·she must keep her promises [the obligations by which she bound herself will stand].

15.verse: But if he cancels them long after he heard about them, he ·is responsible if she breaks her promise [will bear her guilt].”

16.verse: These are ·commands [statutes; ordinances; requirements] that the LORD gave to Moses for husbands and wives, and for fathers with ·daughters living at home [his daughters in her youth in the house of her father].

1.verse: Israel Attacks the Midianites - The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

2.verse: “·Pay back [Avenge] the Midianites for what they did to the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel; 25:6]; after that you will ·die [be gathered to your people].”

3.verse: So Moses said to the people, “·Get some men ready [Arm some men] for war. The LORD will use them to ·pay back [avenge himself against] the Midianites.

4.verse: Send to war a thousand men from each of the tribes of Israel.”

5.verse: So twelve thousand men ·got ready for war [were armed], out of the thousands of Israel a thousand men from each tribe.

6.verse: Moses sent ·those men [a thousand from each tribe] to war; Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest was with them. He took with him the ·holy things [or vessels of the Holy Place] and the trumpets for giving the alarm.

7.verse: They fought the Midianites as the LORD had commanded Moses, and they killed every Midianite man.

8.verse: Among those they killed were Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who were the five kings of Midian. They also killed Balaam son of Beor with a sword [Num. 22–24; Deut. 23:4–5; Josh. 13:22; 24:10; Neh. 13:2; 2 Pet. 2:15; Jude 11; Rev. 2:14].

9.verse: The ·Israelites [sons of Israel] captured the Midianite women and children, and they took all their flocks, herds, and goods.

10.verse: They burned all the Midianite towns where they had settled and all their camps,

11.verse: but they took all the ·people and animals and goods [plunder and all the spoil, both people and animals].

12.verse: Then they brought the captives, the ·animals, and the goods [spoil and the plunder] back to Moses and Eleazar the priest and all the ·Israelites [community/assembly/congregation of the sons/children of Israel]. Their camp was on the plains of Moab near the Jordan River, across from Jericho.

13.verse: Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the ·people [community; assembly; congregation] went outside the camp to meet them.

14.verse: Moses was angry with the army officers, the commanders over a thousand men, and those over a hundred men, who returned from war.

15.verse: He asked them, “Why did you let the women live?

16.verse: They were the ones who followed Balaam’s advice [Jude 11] and turned the ·Israelites [community/assembly/congregation of Israel] from the LORD at Peor. Then a ·terrible sickness [plague] struck the LORD’s people [Num. 25].

17.verse: Kill all the Midianite boys, and kill all the Midianite women who have ·had sexual relations [known a man by going to bed with him].

18.verse: But save for yourselves the girls who have not ·had sexual relations with a man [known a man by going to bed with him].

19.verse: “All you men who killed anyone or touched a dead body must stay outside the camp for seven days [19:11]. On the third and seventh days you and your captives must make yourselves clean [in a ritual sense].

20.verse: You must clean all your clothes and anything made of leather, goat hair, or wood.”

21.verse: Then Eleazar the priest said to the soldiers who had gone to war, “These are the ·teachings [statutes/ordinances/requirements of the law/instruction] that the LORD gave to Moses:

22.verse: Put any gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, or lead—

23.verse: anything that will not burn—into the fire, and then it will be clean. But also purify those things with the cleansing water. Then they will be clean. If something cannot stand the fire, wash it with the water.

24.verse: On the seventh day wash your clothes, and you will be clean. After that you may come into the camp.”

25.verse: Dividing the Goods - The LORD said to Moses,

26.verse: “You, Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the ·family groups [clans of the community/assembly/congregation] should take a count of the ·goods [spoils], the men, and the animals that were taken.

27.verse: Then divide ·those possessions [the spoil] between the soldiers who went to war and the ·rest of the people [community; assembly; congregation].

28.verse: From the soldiers who went to war, take a ·tax [tribute] for the LORD of one item out of every five hundred. This includes people, cattle, donkeys, or sheep.

29.verse: Take it from the soldiers’ half, and give it to Eleazar the priest as the LORD’s ·share [offering].

30.verse: And from the ·people’s half [half of the sons/children of Israel], take one item out of every fifty. This includes people, cattle, donkeys, sheep, or other animals. Give that to the Levites, who take care of the LORD’s ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle].”

31.verse: So Moses and Eleazar did as the LORD commanded Moses.

32.verse: There remained from what the soldiers had taken 675,000 sheep,

35.verse: and 32,000 women who had not ·had sexual relations with a man [known a man by going to bed with him].

36.verse: The soldiers who went to war got 337,500 sheep,

37.verse: and they gave 675 of them to the LORD.

38.verse: They got 36,000 cattle, and they gave 72 of them to the LORD.

39.verse: They got 30,500 donkeys, and they gave 61 of them to the LORD.

40.verse: They got 16,000 people, and they gave 32 of them to the LORD.

41.verse: Moses gave the LORD’s ·share [tribute] to Eleazar the priest, as the LORD had commanded him.

42.verse: Moses separated the ·people’s [sons/children of Israel’s] half from the soldiers’ half.

47.verse: From the ·people’s [sons/children of Israel’s] half Moses took one item out of every fifty for the LORD. This included the animals and the people. Then he gave them to the Levites, who took care of the LORD’s ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle]. This was what the LORD had commanded Moses.

48.verse: Then the officers of the army, the commanders of a thousand men and commanders of a hundred men, came to Moses.

49.verse: They told Moses, “We, your servants, have ·counted [taken a census of; lifted the head of] our soldiers ·under our command [in our hand], and not one of them is missing.

50.verse: So we have brought the LORD a ·gift [offering] of the gold things that each of us found: arm bands, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces. These are to ·remove our sins so we will belong to [make atonement for ourselves before] the LORD.”

51.verse: So Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from them, which had been made into all kinds of objects.

52.verse: The commanders of a thousand men and the commanders of a hundred men gave the LORD the gold, and all of it together weighed about ·420 pounds [16,750 shekels];

53.verse: each soldier had taken ·something [plunder] for himself.

54.verse: Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from the commanders of a thousand men and the commanders of a hundred men. Then they put it in the Meeting Tent as a memorial before the LORD for the ·people [sons; children] of Israel.

1.verse: The Tribes East of the Jordan - The ·people [sons; descendants] of Reuben and ·Gad [the sons/descendants of Gad] had large flocks and herds. When they saw that the lands of Jazer and Gilead were good for the animals,

2.verse: they came to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the ·people [community; assembly; congregation].

3.verse: They said, “We, your servants, have flocks and herds. The LORD has ·captured [struck] for the ·Israelites [the community/assembly/congregation of Israel] a land that is good for animals—the land around Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon.

4.verse: They said, “We, your servants, have flocks and herds. The LORD has ·captured [struck] for the ·Israelites [the community/assembly/congregation of Israel] a land that is good for animals—the land around Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon.

5.verse: If ·it pleases you [we have found grace in your eyes], we would like this land ·to be given to us [as a possession for your servants]. Don’t make us cross the Jordan River.”

6.verse: Moses told the ·people of Gad [sons/descendants of Gad] and ·Reuben [the sons/descendants of Reuben], “Shall your brothers go to war while you stay ·behind [here]?

7.verse: ·You will [Why should you…?] discourage the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] from going over to the land the LORD has given them.

8.verse: Your ·ancestors [fathers] did the same thing. I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to look at the land.

9.verse: They went as far as the ·Valley of [Wadi] Eshcol, and when they saw the land, they discouraged the hearts of the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] from going into the land the LORD had given them.

10.verse: The LORD became very angry that day and ·made this promise [swore]:

11.verse: ‘None of the people who came from Egypt and who are twenty years old or older will see the land that I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. These people have not ·followed me [or been loyal to me] completely.

12.verse: Only Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun ·followed [or were loyal to] the LORD completely [chs. 13–14].’

13.verse: “The LORD was angry with Israel, so he made them wander in the ·desert [wilderness] for forty years. Finally all the ·people [generation] who had ·sinned against [done evil in the eyes/sight of] the LORD died,

14.verse: and now you ·are acting [have risen up] just like your ·ancestors [fathers]! You sinful people are making the LORD even more angry with Israel.

15.verse: If you quit following him, it will add to their stay in the ·desert [wilderness], and you will destroy all these people.”

16.verse: Then ·the Reubenites and Gadites [they] came up to Moses and said, “We will build ·pens for our animals [sheepfolds for our flocks] and cities for our children here.

17.verse: Then our children will be in strong, walled cities, safe from the people who live in this land. Then we will prepare for war. We will help the other ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] get their land,

18.verse: and we will not return home until every Israelite has ·received his land [inherited their inheritance].

19.verse: We won’t ·take [inherit] any of the land west of the Jordan River; our ·part of the land [inheritance] is east of the Jordan.”

20.verse: So Moses told them, “You must do these things. You must go before the LORD into battle

21.verse: and cross the Jordan River armed, until the LORD ·forces out [dispossesses] the enemy.

22.verse: After the LORD helps us take the land, you may return home. You will ·have done your duty to [be free of your obligation; be innnocent before] the LORD and Israel, and you may have this land as ·your own [a possession before the LORD].

23.verse: “But if you don’t do these things, you will be sinning against the LORD; know for sure that ·you will be punished for your sin [your sin will find you].

24.verse: Build cities for your children and ·pens for your animals [sheepfolds for your flocks], but then you must do what you ·promised [said].”

25.verse: The ·Gadites [sons/descendants of Gad] and ·Reubenites [the sons/descendants of Reuben] said to Moses, “We are your servants, and we will do what you, our ·master [lord], command.

26.verse: Our children, wives, and all our cattle will stay in the cities of Gilead,

27.verse: but we, your servants, will prepare for battle. We will go over and fight for the LORD, as you, our ·master [lord], have said.”

28.verse: So Moses gave orders about them to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua son of Nun, and to the leaders of the clans of the tribes of ·Israel [sons/children of Israel].

29.verse: Moses said to them, “If the ·Gadites [sons/descendants of Gad] and ·Reubenites [the sons/descendants of Reuben] prepare for battle and cross the Jordan River with you, to go before the LORD and help you take the land, give them the land of Gilead ·for their own [as a possession].

30.verse: But if they do not go over armed, they will not receive it; their land will be in Canaan with you.”

31.verse: The ·Gadites [sons/descendants of Gad] and ·Reubenites [the sons/descendants of Reuben] answered, “We are your servants, and we will do as the LORD said.

32.verse: We will cross over into Canaan and go before the LORD ready for battle. But ·our land [the possession of our inheritance] will be ·east of [beyond] the Jordan River.”

33.verse: So Moses gave that land to the tribes of ·Gad [the sons/descendants of Gad], ·Reuben [the sons/descendants of Reuben], and ·East [the half tribe of] Manasseh. (Manasseh was Joseph’s son.) That land had been the kingdom of Sihon, king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og, king of Bashan, as well as all the cities and the land around them.

34.verse: The ·Gadites [sons/descendants of Gad] rebuilt the cities of Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,

36.verse: Beth Nimrah, and Beth Haran. These were strong, walled cities. And they built sheep ·pens [folds].

37.verse: The ·Reubenites [sons/descendants of Reuben] rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,

38.verse: Nebo, Baal Meon, and Sibmah. They renamed Nebo and Baal Meon when they rebuilt them.

39.verse: The ·descendants [sons] of Makir son of Manasseh went and captured Gilead and forced out the Amorites who were there.

40.verse: So Moses gave Gilead to the family of Makir son of Manasseh, and they settled there.

41.verse: Jair son of Manasseh went out and captured the ·small towns [villages] there, and he called them the ·Towns of Jair [or Villages of Jair; or Havvoth-jair].

42.verse: Nobah went and captured Kenath and the small towns around it; then he named it Nobah after himself.

1.verse: Israel’s Journey from Egypt - These are the places the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] went as Moses and Aaron led them out of Egypt in divisions [like an army].

2.verse: At the LORD’s command Moses ·recorded [wrote down] the places they went, and these are the places they went.

3.verse: On the fifteenth day of the first month, the day after the Passover [Ex. 12:1–30], the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] left Rameses and marched out ·boldly [with a high hand] in front of all the Egyptians [Ex. 12:31–42].

4.verse: The Egyptians were burying their firstborn sons, whom the LORD had ·killed [struck]; the LORD ·showed that the gods of Egypt were false [or even executed judgment against their gods; Ex. 12:12].

5.verse: The ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] left Rameses and camped at Succoth.

6.verse: They left Succoth and camped at Etham, at the edge of the ·desert [wilderness; Ex. 13:20].

7.verse: They left Etham and went back to Pi Hahiroth, to the east of Baal Zephon, and camped near Migdol [Ex. 14:2].

8.verse: They left Pi Hahiroth and walked through the sea into the ·desert [wilderness; Ex. 14:1–31]. After going three days through the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Etham, they camped at Marah [Ex. 15:23].

9.verse: They left Marah and went to Elim; there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees where they camped [Ex. 15:27].

10.verse: They left Elim and camped near the ·Red [or Reed; Ex. 10:19] Sea.

11.verse: They left the ·Red [or Reed] Sea and camped in the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Sin [Ex. 16:1].

12.verse: They left the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Sin and camped at Dophkah.

13.verse: They left Dophkah and camped at Alush.

14.verse: They left Alush and camped at Rephidim, where the people had no water to drink [Ex. 17:1–7].

15.verse: They left Rephidim and camped in the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Sinai [Ex. 19:1].

16.verse: They left the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Sinai and camped at Kibroth Hattaavah [11:34–35].

17.verse: They left Kibroth Hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth [11:35; 12:16].

18.verse: They left Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.

19.verse: They left Rithmah and camped at Rimmon Perez.

20.verse: They left Rimmon Perez and camped at Libnah.

21.verse: They left Libnah and camped at Rissah.

22.verse: They left Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.

23.verse: They left Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.

24.verse: They left Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.

25.verse: They left Haradah and camped at Makheloth.

26.verse: They left Makheloth and camped at Tahath.

27.verse: They left Tahath and camped at Terah.

28.verse: They left Terah and camped at Mithcah.

29.verse: They left Mithcah and camped at Hashmonah.

30.verse: They left Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.

31.verse: They left Moseroth and camped at Bene Jaakan.

32.verse: They left Bene Jaakan and camped at Hor Haggidgad.

33.verse: They left Hor Haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.

34.verse: They left Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.

35.verse: They left Abronah and camped at Ezion Geber.

36.verse: They left Ezion Geber and camped at Kadesh in the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Zin [20:1].

37.verse: They left Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the border of Edom.

38.verse: Aaron the priest obeyed the LORD and went up Mount Hor. There he died on the first day of the fifth month in the fortieth year after the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] left Egypt [20:22–29].

39.verse: Aaron was 123 years old when he died on Mount Hor.

40.verse: The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the ·southern area of Canaan [Negev], heard that the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] were coming [21:1].

41.verse: The people left Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.

42.verse: They left Zalmonah and camped at Punon.

43.verse: They left Punon and camped at Oboth [21:10].

44.verse: They left Oboth and camped at Iye Abarim, on the border of Moab [21:11].

45.verse: They left Iye Abarim and camped at Dibon Gad.

46.verse: They left Dibon Gad and camped at Almon Diblathaim.

47.verse: They left Almon Diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, near Nebo [27:12].

48.verse: They left the mountains of Abarim and camped on the plains of Moab near the Jordan River across from Jericho.

49.verse: They camped along the Jordan on the plains of Moab, and their camp went from Beth Jeshimoth to Abel Acacia [22:1].

50.verse: On the plains of Moab by the Jordan River across from Jericho, the LORD spoke to Moses. He said,

51.verse: “Speak to the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] and tell them, ‘When you cross the Jordan River and go into Canaan,

52.verse: force out all the people who live there. Destroy all of their carved statues and metal idols. Wreck all of their ·places of worship [high places; worship sites that became associated with pagan worship or inappopriate worship of Yahweh; 1 Kin. 3:2].

53.verse: Take over the land and settle there, because I have given this land to you to own.

54.verse: Throw lots [perhaps the Urim and Thummim; Ex. 28:30; Lev. 8:8] to ·divide up [apportion] the land by ·family groups [clans], giving larger portions to larger ·family groups [clans] and smaller portions to smaller ·family groups [clans]. The land will be given as the lots decide; each tribe will get its own land.

55.verse: “‘But if you don’t force those people out of the land, they will bring you trouble. They will be like ·sharp hooks [barbs] in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will bring trouble to the land where you live.

56.verse: Then I will punish you as I had planned to punish them.’”

1.verse: The Borders of Canaan - The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “Give this command to the ·people [sons/children] of Israel: ‘You will soon enter Canaan and ·it will be yours. These shall be the borders […this is the land that will fall to you as an inheritance, the land of Canaan according to its borders/boundaries]:

3.verse: On the south you will get part of the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Zin near the border of Edom. On the east side your southern border will start at the south end of the ·Dead [Salt] Sea,

4.verse: cross south of ·Scorpion Pass [or the Ascent of Akrabbim], and go through the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Zin and south of Kadesh Barnea. Then it will go to Hazar Addar and over to Azmon.

5.verse: From Azmon it will go to the ·brook [wadi] of Egypt, and it will end at the ·Mediterranean Sea [Sea].

6.verse: “‘Your western border will be the ·Mediterranean [Great] Sea.

7.verse: “‘Your northern border will begin at the ·Mediterranean [Great] Sea and ·go [mark/draw a line] to Mount Hor.

8.verse: From Mount Hor ·it will go [mark/draw a line] to Lebo Hamath, and on to Zedad.

9.verse: Then the border will go to Ziphron, and it will end at Hazar Enan. This will be your northern border.

10.verse: “‘Your eastern border will begin at Hazar Enan and ·go [mark/draw a line] to Shepham.

11.verse: From Shepham the border will go ·east of [down to] Ain to Riblah and ·along [go down to] the hills east of ·Lake [the Sea of] ·Galilee [Kinnereth].

12.verse: Then the border will go down along the Jordan River and end at the ·Dead [Salt] Sea. “‘These are the borders around your country.’”

13.verse: So Moses gave this command to the Israelites: “This is the land you will ·receive [inherit]. Throw lots [perhaps the Urim and Thummim; Ex. 28:30; Lev. 8:8] to divide it among the nine and one-half tribes, because the LORD commanded that it should be theirs.

14.verse: The tribes of ·Reuben [the sons/descendants of Reuben] by their families [clans], ·Gad [the sons/descendants of Gad] by their families [clans], and ·East [the half-tribe of] Manasseh have already ·received [inherited] their land.

15.verse: These two and one-half tribes received ·land [their inheritance] east of the Jordan River, across from Jericho [32:1–42].”

16.verse: Then the LORD said to Moses,

17.verse: “These are the names of the men who will ·divide [apportion] the land for inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.

18.verse: Also take one leader from each tribe to help ·divide [apportion] the land for inheritance.

19.verse: These are the names of the leaders: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;

20.verse: from the tribe of ·Simeon [the sons/descendants of Simeon], Shemuel son of Ammihud;

21.verse: from the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad son of Kislon;

22.verse: from the tribe of ·Dan [the sons/descendants of Dan], Bukki son of Jogli;

23.verse: from the tribe of ·Manasseh [the sons/descendants of Manasseh] son of Joseph, Hanniel son of Ephod;

24.verse: from the tribe of ·Ephraim [the sons/descendants of Ephraim] son of Joseph, Kemuel son of Shiphtan;

25.verse: from the tribe of ·Zebulun [the sons/descendants of Zebulun], Elizaphan son of Parnach;

26.verse: from the tribe of ·Issachar [the sons/descendants of Issachar], Paltiel son of Azzan;

27.verse: from the tribe of ·Asher [the sons/descendants of Asher], Ahihud son of Shelomi;

28.verse: from the tribe of ·Naphtali [the sons/descendants of Naphtali], Pedahel son of Ammihud.”

29.verse: The LORD commanded these men to ·divide [apportion] for inheritance the land of Canaan among the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel].

1.verse: The Levites’ Towns - The LORD spoke to Moses on the plains of Moab across from Jericho by the Jordan River. He said,

2.verse: “Command the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] to give the Levites cities to live in from the ·land [possession] they ·receive [inherit]. Also give the Levites the pastureland around these cities.

3.verse: Then the Levites will have cities where they may live and pastureland for their cattle, flocks, and other animals.

4.verse: The pastureland you give the Levites will extend ·fifteen hundred feet [a thousand cubits] from the city wall.

5.verse: Also measure ·three thousand feet [two thousand cubits] in each direction outside the city wall—·three thousand feet [two thousand cubits] east of the city, ·three thousand feet [two thousand cubits] south of the city, ·three thousand feet [two thousand cubits] west of the city, and ·three thousand feet [two thousand cubits] north of the city, with the city in the center. This will be pastureland for the Levites’ cities.

6.verse: Cities of Safety - “Six of the cities you give the Levites will be cities of ·safety [refuge]. A person who accidentally kills someone may run to one of those cities for ·safety [refuge]. You must also give forty-two other cities to the Levites;

7.verse: give the Levites a total of forty-eight cities and their pastures.

8.verse: The larger tribes of ·Israel [the sons/children of Israel] must give more cities, and the smaller tribes must give fewer cities. Each tribe must give some of its cities to the Levites, but the number of cities they give will depend on the size of their land.”

9.verse: Then the LORD said to Moses,

10.verse: “Tell the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] these things: ‘When you cross the Jordan River and go into Canaan,

11.verse: you must choose cities to be cities of ·safety [refuge], so that a person who ·accidentally [unintentionally] kills someone may run to them for ·safety [refuge].

12.verse: There the person will be safe from the dead person’s ·relative who has the duty of punishing the killer [avenger; near-kinsman]. He will not die before he ·receives a fair trial in court [stands before the community/assembly/congregation for judgment].

13.verse: The six cities you give will be cities of ·safety [refuge].

14.verse: Give three cities ·east of [beyond] the Jordan River and three cities in Canaan as cities of ·safety [refuge].

15.verse: These six cities will be places of ·safety [refuge] for ·citizens [sons; children] of Israel, as well as for ·foreigners [resident aliens] and ·other people living with you [tenants]. Any of these people who ·accidentally [unintentionally] kills someone may run to one of these cities.

16.verse: “‘Anyone who uses an iron weapon to ·kill [strike] someone is a murderer. He must be put to death.

17.verse: Anyone who takes a rock and ·kills [strikes] a person with it is a murderer. He must be put to death.

18.verse: Anyone who picks up a piece of wood and ·kills [strikes] someone with it is a murderer. He must be put to death.

19.verse: A ·relative of the dead person [near-relative; avenger of blood] must put the murderer to death; when they meet, the relative must kill the murderer.

20.verse: A person might shove someone out of hatred or throw something at someone while lying in wait and cause death.

21.verse: Or a person might ·hit [strike] someone with his hand and cause death. If it were done from hate, the person is a murderer and must be put to death. A ·relative of the dead person [near-relative; avenger of blood] must kill the murderer when they meet.

22.verse: “‘But a person might suddenly shove someone, and not from hatred. Or a person might ·accidentally [without lying in wait] throw something and ·hit [strike] someone.

23.verse: Or a person might drop a rock on someone he couldn’t see and kill that person. There was no plan to hurt anyone and ·no hatred for the one who was killed [they were not enemies].

24.verse: If that happens, the ·community [assembly; congregation] must judge between the ·relative of the dead person [near-relative; avenger of blood] and the ·killer [striker], according to these rules.

25.verse: ·They [The community/assembly/congregation] must protect the killer from the ·dead person’s relative [near-relative; avenger of blood], sending the killer back to the original city of ·safety [refuge], to stay there until the high priest dies (the high priest ·had the holy oil poured on him [was anointed with holy oil]).

26.verse: “‘Such a person must never go outside the limits of the city of ·safety [refuge].

27.verse: If a ·relative of the dead person [near-relative; avenger of blood] finds the killer outside the city, the ·relative [near-relative; avenger of blood] may kill that person and ·not be guilty of murder [there will be no bloodguilt].

28.verse: The killer must stay in the city of ·safety [refuge] until the high priest dies. After the high priest dies, the killer may ·go home [return to the land of his possession].

29.verse: “‘These ·laws [statutes/ordinances/requirements and judgments] are for you ·from now on [throughout your generations], wherever you live.

30.verse: “‘If anyone ·kills [strikes] a person, the murderer may be put to death only if there are witnesses. No one may be put to death with only one witness.

31.verse: “‘Don’t take ·money to spare the life of [ransom for] a murderer who should be put to death. A murderer must be put to death.

32.verse: “‘If someone has run to a city of ·safety [refuge], don’t take money to let the person go back home before the high priest dies.

33.verse: “‘Don’t let murder ·spoil [pollute; defile] your land. The only way to ·remove the sin [atone for] of killing an innocent person is for the murderer to be put to death.

34.verse: I am the LORD, and I live among the Israelites. I live in that land with you, so do not ·spoil [pollute; defile] it with murder.’”

1.verse: Land for Zelophehad’s Daughters - The leaders of ·Gilead’s family group [the clan of the sons/descendants of Gilead] went to talk to Moses and the leaders of the ·families [clans] of ·Israel [sons/children of Israel]. (Gilead was the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, the son of Joseph.)

2.verse: They said, “The LORD commanded you, our ·master [lord], to give the land for inheritance to the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] by throwing lots [perhaps the Urim and Thummim; Ex. 28:30; Lev. 8:8], and the LORD commanded you, our master [lord], to give for inheritance the land of Zelophehad, our brother, to his daughters [27:1–11].

3.verse: But if his daughters marry ·men [sons] from other tribes of ·Israel [the sons/children of Israel], then ·that land will leave our family [their inheritance will be taken from the inheritance of our ancestors/fathers], and the people of the other tribes will get that land. So ·we will lose some of our land [part of our allotted portion will be lost].

4.verse: When the time of Jubilee [every fiftieth year; Lev. 25:8–55] comes for the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel], their land will go to the tribes of the people they marry; ·their land will be taken away from us, the land we received from our fathers [the inheritance of the tribe of our ancestors/fathers will be deprived of inheritance].”

5.verse: Then Moses gave the ·Israelites [the sons/children of Israel] this command from the LORD: “These men from the ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Joseph are right.

6.verse: This is the LORD’s command to Zelophehad’s daughters: You may marry anyone you wish, as long as the person is from ·your [a clan of your] own tribe.

7.verse: In this way the ·Israelites’ land [inheritance of the sons/children of Israel] will not pass from tribe to tribe, and each ·Israelite [son/child of Israel] will keep the land in the tribe that belonged to his ·ancestors [fathers].

8.verse: A woman who inherits her father’s land may marry, but she must marry someone from ·her own [a clan of her own] tribe. In this way every ·Israelite [son/child of Israel] will keep the land that belonged to his ·ancestors [fathers].

9.verse: The ·land [inheritance] must not pass from tribe to tribe, and each ·Israelite tribe [tribe of the sons/children of Israel] will keep the land it ·received [inherited] from its ·ancestors [fathers].”

10.verse: Zelophehad’s daughters obeyed the LORD’s command to Moses.

11.verse: So Zelophehad’s daughters—Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah—married ·their cousins, their father’s relatives [sons of their father’s brothers].

12.verse: Their husbands were from the ·tribe of [clan of the sons of] Manasseh son of Joseph, so their ·land [inheritance] stayed in their father’s ·family group [clan] and tribe.

13.verse: These were the laws and commands that the LORD gave to the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] through Moses on the plains of Moab by the Jordan River, across from Jericho.
